On Thu, 23 Feb 2006, Jon Skeet <jon.skeet@...> wrote:
> David Saff wrote:
>> Excellent idea.  If anyone has an "inside connection" to ant, 
>> let me know.
> 
> I'm an emeritus committer for Ant, and get on well with some of the
> head honchos.

I might be considered one of those "head honchos" ;-)

> I've volunteered on the Ant mailing list to be a conduit between
> these two lists,

You are more than welcome to do so.

> One of the things near the top of my priority list is that we don't
> get into the current mess again whereby you need to add JUnit's jar
> file to Ant's lib directory (or specify -lib ...) due to the JUnit
> task already being part of the distribution.

+1

BTW, junit.jar can be specified on the task's <classpath> in Ant 1.7
(it can in svn trunk since a few hours, thanks to Jesse Glick).

> To be honest, I think the JUnit project should "own" the Ant task
> more than Ant should.

That would probably help a lot, yes.  Ant still maintains the jspc
task for Tomcat 4 but Tomcat "owns" the ones for Tomcat 5+, a similar
model could be used for the junit task.

I'd recommend an Ant library distributed and maintained by the JUnit
project.  If the JUnit team doesn't want to take ownership of the
task, it still should be distributed independent of Ant as an antlib
(maybe in the antlibs subproject of Ant).

Stefan
